image.altText: A woman speaking on a TV

props.synopsis: Australia's social media ban for children makes headlines around the world, including as far away as Russia, as articles question how it could work and whether similar laws would be introduced elsewhere.

title.children: Social media ban on children in 'Land of Kangaroos' makes global headlines

image.altText: pm courtyard social media

props.synopsis: The prime minister has lauded the passage of a world-first social media ban for children after the Senate's marathon late-night sitting. Follow live.

title.children: PM tells parents 'we've got your back' after social media ban passes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Education minister says social media ban won't 'be perfect'
TikTok and Snapchat respond to social media ban
Coalition wants a slice of the glory on social media ban

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: There are new laws for supermarkets, housing developers, victims of sexual violence, the Reserve Bank and many more, after the government ticked off dozens of items on its to-do list in a single night.

title.children: Australia's laws have suddenly changed on tax benefits and 12 other big issues

image.altText: An Indigenous man with long grey hair leaves court.

props.synopsis: The 72-year-old south-west Victorian Indigenous leader has been jailed for six years and two months over 25 fraud-related charges.

title.children: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark jailed for defrauding Framlingham Indigenous community

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: With just a few weeks left of his political career, speculation is mounting about who President Joe Biden might pardon before he leaves office and hands over power to Donald Trump.

title.children: With just weeks left in power, Biden has some big, controversial names to consider for pardons

image.altText: A white background is tiled with mobile versions of webstores. In the foreground are desktop versions

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has uncovered dozens of online clothing stores pretending to be high-end Australian fashion boutiques. Customers are sometimes shipped cheap, low-quality goods made in Asia, and sometimes, nothing at all.

title.children: We uncovered 57 online clothing shops trying to scam Australians. And they’re just the tip of the iceberg

image.altText: Putin standing at a podium

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has threatened to use new Oreshnik hypersonic missile to attack "decision-making centres" in Kyiv in response to Ukraine's firing of Western missiles at Russian territory.

title.children: Vladimir Putin threatens to use new Oreshnik hypersonic missile to attack 'decision-making centres' in Kyiv

image.altText: A man walking on a road in front of a pile of rubble

props.synopsis: Israel's military said on Thursday it had detected "suspects" in several areas in southern Lebanon, calling this a violation of a ceasefire with Hezbollah.

title.children: Israel and Hezbollah accuse each other of breaching two-day-old ceasefire

image.altText: Sun shines against power pole in NSW.

props.synopsis: The latest independent scorecard shows that Australia is falling behind in its bid to meet the government's legislated 2030 target.

title.children: Australia falls dramatically short of 2030 emissions reduction goal, latest independent scorecard shows

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie and shades

props.synopsis: Three men from Sydney have been sentenced to prison over their sexual assaults against three women in their late teens, with the longest term being 14 years.

title.children: Bucks party trio handed lengthy jail sentences for 'cold, callous, degrading' gang rape of three women

image.altText: A politician cartoon showing dinosaurs arguing about nuclear and gas power.

props.synopsis: Upon being named the 2024 Political Cartoonist of the Year, Megan Herbert demanded a recount.

title.children: The best political cartoons of 2024 are on display at Old Parliament House

image.altText: PFAS firefighting foam

props.synopsis: Researchers of a new study into how a type of PFAS breaks down in the environment say their findings underline the need to better monitor a wider range of "forever chemicals".

title.children: Soon-to-be-banned 'forever chemical' more widespread than previously thought

image.altText: Home set up for making alcohol in Cambodia, 2014.

props.synopsis: The deaths of six backpackers, including two Australian teenagers, have highlighted the dangers of contaminated alcohol in South-East Asia. But it's a danger locals live with daily.

title.children: 'I miss him when it rains': The devastating impact of methanol poisonings across Asia

image.altText: A side on shot of a man wearing a black suit next to a woman in a black blazer walking looking ahead.

props.synopsis: Kristian White remains on bail, avoiding time behind bars ahead of sentencing for the manslaughter of the 95-year-old in an aged-care home.

title.children: Cop who fatally tasered Clare Nowland remains on bail

image.altText: Some US sailors in formation, walking past a submarine which is draped in American flags.

props.synopsis: Australia is expected to acquire three Virginia-class submarines in the 2030s as part of the agreement.

title.children: Concerns over future of AUKUS as $8.8 billion 'emergency funding' plea made for key submarine program

image.altText: Virat Kohli batting during a training session.

props.synopsis: India has dominated Australia in Test cricket for the past decade but as New Zealand recently showed the key to beating the Men in Blue may lie in players who hail from South Asia.

title.children: 'We take cricket with us': Why the face of Australian cricket must change

image.altText: Clare Polkinghorne claps

props.synopsis: Before the Matildas took to the field against Brazil at Lang Park, Clare Polkinghorne was honoured with an emotional outpouring for love for what was her final game on home soil. But all she wanted to do was play football.

title.children: 'Let's get on with it': Tears, applause and a stoic attitude to the very end for a Matildas legend

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: The local share market is in the red. The ACCC gives interim clearance to Virgin and Qatar alliance, allowing 28 extra flights weekly. Meanwhile, Cbus chair Wayne Swan has appeared before a Senate committee to address questions about claim payout delays. Follow the day's events and insights on our markets blog.

title.children: Virgin-Qatar deal cleared for take-off, ASX falls, Cbus faces Senate grilling

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ACCC gives green light for more Qatar Airways flights
Australian shares keep declining at lunch
Cbus chair 'sick in the guts' over delays in paying insurance claims

image.altText: A woman with beige headphones and a tote bag walks past a shop window advertising 50 per cent off.

props.synopsis: Australians are set to spend almost $7 billion in just four days during this year's Black Friday-Cyber Monday sales, as the cost of living sees more shoppers eager to snap up a bargain.

title.children: Black Friday sales set to be the biggest on record despite cost of living pressures

image.altText: CCTV captures Townsville car theft

props.synopsis: Police have found the firearm and ammunition allegedly stolen from a police car in a secure car park complex in north Queensland on Sunday.

title.children: Gun allegedly stolen from unmarked police car recovered after extensive search

image.altText: A man holds a big camera while a person wipes their eye

props.synopsis: Police clashed with pro-EU protesters in Georgia's capital Tbilisi after the ruling party said it would suspend talks on European Union accession until 2028. They used used water cannons, pepper spray and tear gas, injuring journalists in the process.

title.children: Journalists injured as Georgian police clash with protesters against EU accession delay

image.altText: Two reconstructions of ancient human species side by side, one very ape looking the other a broad faced human-like head.

props.synopsis: Newly discovered fossil footprints indicate two different ancient human relatives walked upright around a muddy lake in Kenya.

title.children: Footprints suggest two types of ancient human relatives walked side by side 1.5 million years ago

image.altText: a couple posing with friends in the VIP section of a concert

props.synopsis: Property developer David McWilliams and his wife Laura Fullarton owned a sprawling property portfolio, drove luxury cars, and travelled the world, but their business empire was unravelling amid an ASIC investigation.

title.children: ASIC investigation unravels NDIS property developer's luxury life

image.altText: A white Powerball lotto ticket with a black logo and lottery numbers and red coding messages on each side

props.synopsis: A mystery winner from Melbourne has come forward to claim his share of the latest Powerball prize, following the earlier announcement of a Queensland couple as winning ticket holders.

title.children: Powerball $100 million lotto's second jackpot winner revealed

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing sunglasses and holding a small baby wearing a jacket and beanie.

props.synopsis: You may love your work, but are you working too much? Despite a growing awareness of burnout and work-life balance, many of us still see working long hours as a badge of honour.

title.children: Reformed workaholics have a warning for you

image.altText: Sri Lanka batter Vishwa Fernando is clean bowled during a cricket Test.

props.synopsis: If you thought Australia had it bad in the first Test against India, spare a thought for Sri Lanka after it was bowled out for just 42 in South Africa.

title.children: Sri Lanka suffers the fastest collapse in 100 years, all out for just 42 against South Africa

image.altText: A wide shot of a bushfire burning in the distance at night.

props.synopsis: Authorities are growing in confidence that they are starting to gain the upper hand on a huge bushfire that has been threatening a string of coastal communities north of Perth.

title.children: Hope the worst of threat has passed as WA bushfire emergency enters fifth day

image.altText: A woman with a short brown bob and rounded glasses wearing a grey blazer sits in a room with a small microphone in front of her.

props.synopsis: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says Australia's strategy of reducing inflation without stoking too much unemployment is part of the reason why it looks different to peer economies right now.

title.children: RBA governor Bullock says the rise in public sector jobs is keeping Australia's economy on an 'even keel'

image.altText: a large rock in the Wimmera overlooking vast plains of green and trees

props.synopsis: Victoria's environment minister has placed the body that manages the state's parks under a "comprehensive review" in an effort to improve administration.

title.children: Parks Victoria under review, CEO steps down as government seeks a better way

image.altText: Jasprit Bumrah celebrates with his arms out wide

props.synopsis: Jasprit Bumrah completely destroyed Australia in Perth, his unique action continuing to befuddle Australia's best batters. It's what is putting him on the path to greatness.

title.children: Jasprit Bumrah's action is unique, and it's setting him apart

image.altText: Yusril Ihza Mahendra wearing a white shirt with sleeves leaning over a microphone and gesturing with his left hand

props.synopsis: A senior Indonesian minister says Jakarta could respect any Australian decision about what happens to Bali Nine members who return home in a proposed prisoner transfer deal.

title.children: Indonesian minister signals approval for potential release of Bali Nine on return to Australia

image.altText: Clare Polkinghorne poses for a photo, looking over her shoulder with a gold backdrop

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Think you've been paying attention to the news?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A politician and a Matildas player retire while a police officer wrangles an animal
